snippet.textDisplay:
I've been on a video game music binge lately. This game's soundtrack is great. Huge game, and different music at day or night. That's impressive. If at gun point, I'd say my favorite song was Satorl Marsh at night. 

Shame I haven't finished this game yet. I like almost everything about it, except where I'm at in the game, it seems the fetch stuff quests far outweigh the kill stuff quests. Or at least offer more experience. Does this change after a while? I'm way under leveled, and just stopped. I re visit it every once in a while and go back to old towns, enjoy the music and finish new quests that pop up. Even unfinished, this is still one of my favorite games on the console, and one of my favorite game soundtracks of all time.
snippet.textOriginal:
I've been on a video game music binge lately. This game's soundtrack is great. Huge game, and different music at day or night. That's impressive. If at gun point, I'd say my favorite song was Satorl Marsh at night. 

Shame I haven't finished this game yet. I like almost everything about it, except where I'm at in the game, it seems the fetch stuff quests far outweigh the kill stuff quests. Or at least offer more experience. Does this change after a while? I'm way under leveled, and just stopped. I re visit it every once in a while and go back to old towns, enjoy the music and finish new quests that pop up. Even unfinished, this is still one of my favorite games on the console, and one of my favorite game soundtracks of all time.

snippet.textDisplay: Everything about this game, I tell you. I return to Colony 9 nearly every time I play; not just for the numerous quests to finish, and not just for the unexplored areas, but mostly to run around to this song.  I haven't had the urge to return to an area to soak up the tunes since Chrono Trigger. And with the excellent story and well-paced story, I can safely say this is my favorite RPG in the last 10 years.
snippet.textOriginal: Everything about this game, I tell you. I return to Colony 9 nearly every time I play; not just for the numerous quests to finish, and not just for the unexplored areas, but mostly to run around to this song.  I haven't had the urge to return to an area to soak up the tunes since Chrono Trigger. And with the excellent story and well-paced story, I can safely say this is my favorite RPG in the last 10 years.

snippet.textDisplay: I would have expected Mitsuda to have done this seeing the Celtic styling and how he was also a composer on this OST. But then I remembered she did the Legend of Mana and it definitely matches up. Just shows her versatility as a composer. Big fan of hers for a reason.

snippet.textDisplay: I played this game around 110 hours and enjoyed every second of it. I played it with the classic controller and it was really comfortable. The soundtrack is really awesome. snippet.textDisplay:
I absolutely adore this game. I'm at about level 65 now, so I think in the second half of the story now, and it's amazing.
What I also love is that at a certain point, "Mechanical Rhythm" becomes the standard battle music for even the most unimportant fight. This game just rocks.
snippet.textOriginal:
I absolutely adore this game. I'm at about level 65 now, so I think in the second half of the story now, and it's amazing.
What I also love is that at a certain point, "Mechanical Rhythm" becomes the standard battle music for even the most unimportant fight. This game just rocks.

snippet.textDisplay: This game is the most amazing RPG I've played in a long while. I can't believe you're waiting til the summer! Such amazing willpower!
snippet.textOriginal: This game is the most amazing RPG I've played in a long while. I can't believe you're waiting til the summer! Such amazing willpower!

snippet.textDisplay: Great music, really love the guitar playing. and that violin. I hear nothing but good things about this and while I enjoyed FFXIII and it's sequel, it's nice to see a different JRPG be getting so much love and rekindling interest in the genre. I hope it never dies because there's something so special about JRPGs that I just always find lacking in WPRGs...I don't know if it's the art design, music or characters but there's an enchantment I don't find anywhere else.
snippet.textOriginal: Great music, really love the guitar playing. and that violin. I hear nothing but good things about this and while I enjoyed FFXIII and it's sequel, it's nice to see a different JRPG be getting so much love and rekindling interest in the genre. I hope it never dies because there's something so special about JRPGs that I just always find lacking in WPRGs...I don't know if it's the art design, music or characters but there's an enchantment I don't find anywhere else.

snippet.textDisplay: I agree; it's been years since a game this great has been released.  I'm about 13 hours in so far, and I can already see this taking my third-favorite-of-all-time slot (after Chrono Cross and Chrono Trigger).
snippet.textOriginal: I agree; it's been years since a game this great has been released.  I'm about 13 hours in so far, and I can already see this taking my third-favorite-of-all-time slot (after Chrono Cross and Chrono Trigger).

snippet.textDisplay: Amazing game!  It's partially restored my faith that devs can still produce great JRPGs.  If you can, play it on Dolphin and bump up the resolution, it looks really good!
snippet.textOriginal: Amazing game!  It's partially restored my faith that devs can still produce great JRPGs.  If you can, play it on Dolphin and bump up the resolution, it looks really good!

snippet.textDisplay:
It must be a written law, in all video games for all time, birds will be your greatest enemies.
Ninja Gaiden, Morrowwind, Zelda II, Xenoblade, the list goes on.
snippet.textOriginal:
It must be a written law, in all video games for all time, birds will be your greatest enemies.
Ninja Gaiden, Morrowwind, Zelda II, Xenoblade, the list goes on.

snippet.textDisplay:
Glad to have this game. One of my favorite games in ages. Seriously, I can find myself lately raging at plenty of modern stuff, but I've only encountered one bad moment so far, and I'm nearly 20 hours in!
All I'll say is it involves giant birds trolling the hell out of me. No, they aren't out of my league or anything, but they do like getting the attention of every single enemy in the damn area, including the ones 60 levels above me. I don't pick fights with these birds, they're just trolls!
snippet.textOriginal:
Glad to have this game. One of my favorite games in ages. Seriously, I can find myself lately raging at plenty of modern stuff, but I've only encountered one bad moment so far, and I'm nearly 20 hours in!
